3105, rue Hochelaga |intersections=rue Hochelaga / rue Moreau[http://www.stm.info/English/metro/Prefontaine.pdf PrÃ©fontaine Station Neighbourhood Map] |}} '''PrÃ©fontaine''' is a [[metro station|station]] on the [[Line 1 Green (Montreal Metro)|Green Line]] of the [[Montreal Metro]] [[Rapid transit|rapid transit system]] operated by the [[SociÃ©tÃ© de transport de MontrÃ©al]] (STM). It is in the district of [[Hochelaga-Maisonneuve]] in the borough of [[MercierâHochelaga-Maisonneuve]] in [[Montreal]], [[Quebec]], [[Canada]][http://www.stm.info/English/metro/a-m26.htm Prefontaine Station]. It opened on June 6, 1976, as part of the extension of the Green Line to [[HonorÃ©-Beaugrand (Montreal Metro)|HonorÃ©-Beaugrand]]. ==Overview== [[File:Ãdicule PrÃ©fontaine.jpg|thumb|left|The exterior of PrÃ©fontaine station.]] Designed by Henri Brillon, it is a normal [[side platform]] station, built partly in [[tunnel]] with a large [[Tunnel#Cut-and-cover|open cut]] containing an entrance, the [[Mezzanine (architecture)|mezzanine]] and admitting natural light. A secondary entrance is located to the north of rue Hochelaga. ==Origin of the name== The station is named for rue PrÃ©fontaine and the parc Raymond-PrÃ©fontaine. [[Raymond PrÃ©fontaine]] (1850â1905) was mayor of the former city of Hochelaga, and subsequently mayor of Montreal (1898â1902). ==Connecting bus routes== [[Image:Montreal - Metro, PrÃ©fontaine-20050328.jpg|right|thumb|A train leaving PrÃ©fontaine Metro station]] {{Main|SociÃ©tÃ© de transport de MontrÃ©al}} {{Main|List of Montreal Bus Routes}}
